Package SELECTive

Class User

  • java.lang.Object
    • SELECTive.User
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    Admin, Lecturer, Student
    public class User
extends java.lang.Object
    The core class for any user of the system. It handles all basic functionalities shared by all user types. Some functions are prepared for extra functionality of specific uber classes, but the class does ensure rights are checked.

    • Constructor Detail

      • User

        public User()
        An empty constructor which also checks that not several users are created at the same time.

      • User

        public User​(User copy,
            UserType target)
        An initial constructor to be used in the defined subclasses to create themselves based upon a user
        Parameters:
        copy - User denoting the user to initialize with
        target - UserType the type of user to be created, if this is not the same as the one attached to the user the type is set to DEFAULT - denoting failure

    • Method Detail

      • getUserType

        public UserType getUserType()
        Gets the current users USerType
        Returns:
        UserType of the current user

      • createNewUser

        public User createNewUser​(java.lang.String uname,
                          char[] pword,
                          UserType utype,
                          User admin)
        Initializer taking all the required information for an initialized User class
        Parameters:
        uname - String representing the username the user wishes to use
        pword - char[] representing the password the user would like to use
        utype - UserType representing the type of user to create
        admin - Admin the admin creating the user
        Returns:
        boolean indicating if the creation of the user account was successful

      • getInvalidID

        public java.lang.String getInvalidID()
        Gets the current `invalidID`. This is usually not required outside of the context of the User class, however, it is an important factor for validation, so if pre-validation ever needs to be done a comparison of this value to another UserId could give important insights.
        Returns:
        String representing the invalid id

      • login

        public boolean login​(java.lang.String username,
                     char[] password)
        Login a user. The login function will continously call authenticate user, until the maximum login attempts have been reached. If this occurs, it is assumed that the user might have forgotten their password. If the user is of type admin, they can directly change their password. Otherwise they need to request an admin to change their password since they are the only ones allowed to change passwords without knowledge of the previous password. If successful, and active session is defined.
        Parameters:
        username - String the username of the user attempting to login
        password - char[] the password of the user attempting to login (char[] for security purposes)
        Returns:
        boolean representing if the login was successful

      • createActiveSession

        private void createActiveSession()
        Creates an active session by reading in the user data

      • isSessionActive

        public boolean isSessionActive()
        A simple function that is used internally to check if a session is active. Activeness is tested by ensuring the session ID is not the specified `invaldID` as well as the fact that the current time has not passed the expiration time.
        Returns:
        boolean indicating if the session is active - or not

      • invalidateSession

        public void invalidateSession()
        Invalidates a session by changing the ID to the invalidID as well as setting the expiration time to 1 hour prior

      • forceInvalidSessionBurnout

        public void forceInvalidSessionBurnout()
        Not only invalidates a session, but also closes the system if the user does not relogin

      • authenticateUser

        private boolean authenticateUser​(java.lang.String uname,
                                 char[] pword)
        Authenticates a user based on the username and password provided. Username is stored usind MD5 hashing and the password is stored usind SHA256 hashing. All passwords are handled as char[] since garbage collection for Strings is not immediate, and thus this could be a security issue. If the user is authenticated, the user name is stored. Password is cleared.
        Parameters:
        uname - String: the username of the user requesting authentication
        pword - char[]: the password, passed as a char array for security reasons (see above)
        Returns:
        boolean: indicating if authentication was successful

      • changePassword

        public boolean changePassword​(char[] oldPassword,
                              char[] newPassword)
        Allows the current user to change their password
        Parameters:
        oldPassword - char[] the old password to change
        newPassword - char[] the new password to overwrite the old one with
        Returns:
        bool indicating if the change was successful

      • changePassword

        public boolean changePassword​(java.lang.String uname,
                              char[] oldPassword,
                              char[] newPassword)
        Allows a user to change their password. If the user is an admin, then no old password is required. If an admin is not specifically changing another users password and the password change should only occur for the current user - use changePassword(char[] oldPassword, char[] newPassword)
        Parameters:
        uname - String the username for which a password change should occur
        oldPassword - char[] the old password
        newPassword - char[] the new password to overwrite the old one with
        Returns:
        bool that indicates if the change was successful

      • hasNoUsers

        public static boolean hasNoUsers()
        A static method that checks if any users exist in the system. Can be used to evaluate if a default admin must be created. Also checks if a root exists, if not create it.
        Returns:
        bool indicating if no users are present

      • userExists

        public static boolean userExists​(java.lang.String username)
        Checks if a specific user exists
        Parameters:
        username - String the username of the user to check for existence
        Returns:
        bool indicating if the user was found

      • getUserId

        public java.lang.String getUserId()
        Returns the user id
        Returns:
        String the user ID

      • readDictFromFile

        private java.lang.String[][] readDictFromFile​(java.lang.String fname)
        Reads a form of dictionary used by the system. The format is used for the user authentication. Each line of the authentication file is in the form: 
             [MD5 hash of username] : [SHA256 hash of password] : [Type of user]
        Parameters:
        fname - String the filename from which to read the specific dictionary
        Returns:
        String[][] representing the occurances split into their respective sections denoted by the format

      • writeDictToFile

        private boolean writeDictToFile​(java.lang.String[][] dict,
                                java.lang.String fname,
                                boolean overwrite)
        Writes a system dict to the specified file. Usually used to update the authentication file. For the format check the reading function defined in `see`
        Parameters:
        dict - String[][] which is the system dict to write
        fname - String representing the file to write to
        overwrite - boolean that indicates if the file should be overwritten or appended to
        Returns:
        bool representing if the write was successful
        See Also:
        writeDictToFile(String[][], String, boolean)

      • readUserInfo

        private java.lang.String[] readUserInfo​(User someone)
        Reads the data connected to a certain user
        Parameters:
        someone - User the user to get the information for
        Returns:
        String[] representing the users information

      • updateUserInfo

        private boolean updateUserInfo​(User you)
        Updates a users record after anythin has changed
        Parameters:
        you - User the user whose data should be changed
        Returns:
        bool indicating if the update was successful

      • saveNewUser

        private boolean saveNewUser​(char[] pword,
                            User them)
        Saves a newly created user to both the appropriate database file and the authentication database. If the latter fails, an exception should be caught resulting in to user info being stored. This not only allows for ensuring redundent users arent stored anywhere in the DB but also that without the "crucial" parts nothing is stored.
        Parameters:
        pword - char[] of the password for the user
        them - User representing the new User + subType to store in the subType specific location
        Returns:
        boolean representing if the saving was entirely complete or failed at any stage

      • targetFileExists

        private boolean targetFileExists​(java.lang.String fname)
        Checks if a file exists at the specified path. If it doesn't the function automatically creates the file. IMPORTANT! This function does take action if a file is not found, the boolean return is mainly there to check if file creation failed in the case it wasn't found. By calling this function a missing file will be created thus - in a sense - fixing the issue.
        Parameters:
        fname - String representing the file name/path relative to the current directory
        Returns:
        boolean indicating if the file exists after completion of this function

      • showPasswordRules

        public static void showPasswordRules()
        Prints out the rules for the user to see - should be called before any account creation or password change

      • validPassword

        public static boolean validPassword​(char[] pword)
        Checks if a password is valid. Is always called internally when a new user is created or password changed, but also can be called externally to not have to call either previous functions without knowing if the given password is valid.
        Parameters:
        pword - char[] the password to validate
        Returns:
        bool indicating if the password is valid or not

      • containsAtLeast

        private static boolean containsAtLeast​(java.lang.String regex,
                                       int minCount,
                                       java.lang.String str)
        This function checks, based on a regex, how many times a match is found. It then checks if this amount is equal to or greater than the required minimum. Mainly only for use in the validatePassword(char[] pword) function and is thus private to the User class.
        Parameters:
        regex - String representing the pattern (regex) to use
        minCount - int representing the minimum amount of matches required
        str - String representing the string to search
        Returns:
        bool indicating if the `minCount` of matches occured

      • hashUsername

        private static java.lang.String hashUsername​(java.lang.String uname)
        Applies the MD5 hash alogrithm to the users username. Eventhough MD5 is no loger considered cryptographically secure, it is good enough for obscuring an actual username. If this were to be bruteforced, to gain access this would still require attacking SHA256 - a cryptographically secure algoritm.
        Parameters:
        uname - String of the username to encrypt using MD5
        Returns:
        String the hash of the passed username

      • hashPassword

        private static java.lang.String hashPassword​(char[] pword)
        Applies the secure SHA256 hashing algorithm to the password.
        Parameters:
        pword - char[] representing the password to encrypt using SHA-256
        Returns:
        String representing the encrypted password

      • createRootAdmin

        private static User createRootAdmin()
        Creates a new root user
        Returns:
        bool indicating if the creation was a success
